channel.title: Comments on: Stop Being a Worry Wart

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Agreed. Here's to hoping we can actually apply this in our games!
item.content:encoded: Agreed. Here’s to hoping we can actually apply this in our games!

item.title: By: jcdyer3
item.dc:creator: jcdyer3
item.description: Perhaps another way of looking at it is don't make the supporting move unless you can actually read a way for your opponent to exploit the situation without it. at any rate, that would be an interesting exercise to practice.
item.content:encoded: Perhaps another way of looking at it is don’t make the supporting move unless you can actually read a way for your opponent to exploit the situation without it. at any rate, that would be an interesting exercise to practice.

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Anytime! I'm glad that documenting my thoughts on these kinds of things are helpful!
item.content:encoded: Anytime! I’m glad that documenting my thoughts on these kinds of things are helpful!

item.title: By: RisingStar
item.dc:creator: RisingStar
item.description: Thanks a lot for the advice. This is just the kind of post I needed because I just lost a game on Pandanet-IGS and the game has been bugging me all week. Also, I like the part about how we make mistakes. "We make mis­takes. We fall. We get back up. We learn. We grow. We get stronger. And the cycle goes on and on…" I'm going to give this advice to the people in my go club. Thanks again for the advice!
item.content:encoded: Thanks a lot for the advice. This is just the kind of post I needed because I just lost a game on Pandanet-IGS and the game has been bugging me all week. Also, I like the part about how we make mistakes. “We make mis­takes. We fall. We get back up. We learn. We grow. We get stronger. And the cycle goes on and on…” I’m going to give this advice to the people in my go club. Thanks again for the advice!
